Interface ServerInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Server
public interface ServerInterface
Defines the interface for server-side operations that are exposed to the ClientHandler instances. This interface abstracts the core server functionalities related to managing games and clients, allowing different communication technologies (like RMI or Sockets) to interact with the server logic through a common set of methods.
Version:
1.0
Author:
giacomoamaducci

  • Method Details

    • getActiveGames

      List<GenericGameData> getActiveGames()
      Requests the controllers for all active games connected to the server.

      As Controller does not implement Serializable, the return value of this function is a list of GenericGameData. Each GenericGameData object contains information about the controlled game like active players, maximum player number, and the games UUID.

      Returns:
      al List<GenericGameData> with information about all active controllers.

    • setUsername

      boolean setUsername(ClientHandler client, String username)
      Requests the server to set the username for a connected client.
      Parameters:
      client - the handler for the player wanting to join the game.
      username - the String representing the username the player wants to use.
      Returns:
      true if the name is set successfully or false if the name is already in use by another client.

    • addPlayerToGame

      void addPlayerToGame(ClientHandler client, UUID gameId) throws GameFullException
      Requests the server to add a player to an active game. When the player is added successfully, the UUID generated for that player is returned to the caller.
      Parameters:
      client - the handler for the player wanting to join the game.
      gameId - the UUID of the game the player wants to join.
      Throws:
      GameFullException

    • createNewGame

      UUID createNewGame(int players, int level)
      Requests the server to create a new game. When the game is successfully created, the UUID generated for it is returned to the caller.
      Parameters:
      players - the number of players required for the game to start.
      level - the level of the game.
      Returns:
      the UUID generated by the server for the newly created game.
